This changeset updates Wookie to provide an API that more closely matches the official W3C Widgets: API Specification.
Fixed README to note resolution of WOOKIE-14 and WOOKIE-13 bugs
Implemented GET for Participants, returning a representation of participants in the given instance.
Updated all tests to JUnit4-style (see WOOKIE-27); completed more functional tests; moved GadgetUtils into an Integration tests package.
finished updating to JUnit4

Made the behaviour of the Widgets controller consistent with the API definition, and added functional tests. Also factored out the representation to a helper class, so each one gets its categories in its XML (see WOOKIE-10).
Added tests for the GET method using instance id_key instead of complete instance parameters, consistent with the REST API doc.
move over
fix the paths
This is a fix for WOOKIE-43, renaming the classes of installed server features in the DB script
Committed patch supplied against WOOKIE-25, problem with email errors reported as success
Applied patch for WOOKIE-24, fixing package names in javadoc comments
put a null guard on author element - see WOOKIE-38
Added checks for default start files as well as custom start files in config.xml, and added some error messages for different error conditions associated with this. See also WOOKIE-45
Merging back in standalone branch
Added fix for a problem with Ivy download reported by David Sherlock - Thanks to David for the report, and thanks to Ross Gardler for the fix. More info: http://markmail.org/thread/ytuktdzgxfekwaew
Fixed incorrect namespace for Ivy

Fix for issue WOOKIE-54 affecting processing of widgets using unicode whitespace characters; also fixed issues relating to non-localized elements and repeat elements. Overall this changeset should fix about 12 or so conformance errors.

Removed binaries from the shindig integration module; these will be replaced with an Ivy dependency management solution as part of delivering WOOKIE-52. In the meantime they just add bloat to a checkout. I've included a text document that lists all the removed libs for anyone who wants to manually build an integrated Wookie-Shindig server in the meantime.
Fix for WOOKIE-43 when using derby; this was missed out earlier when applying patches to the build system.

Fix for WOOKIE-55 adding the "widget-short-name" field to the Widget database, and WidgetShortName to Widget class, and added support in the upload process and also in any XML representations returned from the REST API. Also fixed a conformance error with repetitions of name elements in a locale being appended in the manifest parser.

Fixed WOOKIE-48. This involved switching from int to Integer for representing height and width of Widget objects, impacting a number of classes including test cases. Also extended the metadata returned by REST API to help with testing.
fixed an issue with the mapping of opensocial tokens by hibernate; in some cases these could exceed 255 characters, which is the default mapping Derby offers for a string.

Added automated conformance testing for W3C Widgets: Packaging and Configuration; this implements 100 of the 147 tests developed by the W3C team (another 47 are placeholders that require further work). Note that I've made a small change to the upload results page to make it easier to collect error messages. (Thanks to Marcos Caceres for the encouragement!)
Included commons-io in dependencies
Fixed minor message numbering issue (duplicate message 28)
Added the "value" and "readonly" attributes when outputting a Widget XML representation, and implemented the W3C conformance tests for widget preferences

Refactoring of the processing model for Widgets uploaded into Wookie. It addresses issues WOOKIE-56, WOOKIE-57, and closes some loopholes in the solution for WOOKIE-45. Overall a much larger number of W3C test cases can now pass.
Added fix for WOOKIE-53 (thanks to Ate Douma for the patch)
Fix for WOOKIE-44 the impl of the sharedDataForKey DWR method was not catching nulls; I've trapped these now and return the "No matching key found" error message as per preferenceForKey().
Added the widget object to the global window object, as per W3C Widget Interface spec
Added more specific exception types (and messages) for common manifest problems with start files and content types
Added <author> element to widget data exposed by wookie, and implemented more W3C conformance tests
Refactored the WidgetInstancesController to better separate the concerns of processing REST requests, representing  WidgetInstance resources, and minting new instances
Added missing license headers

added length hint for opensocial token field; this avoids an occasional DB issue with Derby, which may set this to VARCHAR255 - this is usually sufficient but escaping can push it a few characters over this length.
Fixed some issues in the YouDecide widget. This should be much easier to manage after we apply WOOKIE-50 and WOOKIE-51
Replaced binary widget packages with source files and build scripts as per WOOKIE-50 and WOOKIE-51 (thanks to Ross Gardler for the patch)
Updated conformance tests to latest versions

Implemented a watched folder solution for WOOKIE-51 that allows hot deployment of widgets by dropping in .wgt files. This also involved separating further the WidgetPackageUtils methods from the servlet concerns, and pushing more widget package processing out of the admin servlet.
Refactored WidgetAdmin, removing unused methods and pushing some things down into the Widget bean class
Added moderator preference to manifest
Added meaningful error log messages
Localized console messages for hot deploy; also added a check to ensure a dropped widget was not a duplicate of existing
Added manifests for default widgets

Applied patch supporting dynamic build and deploy of widgets (thanks to Ross Gardler for the patch) and removed the default widgets from the core package and  database creation scripts; these are now added dynamically. (Note that this means default widgets are no longer placed in categories). This fix applies to WOOKIE-51
Updated README
Applying patch for WOOKIE-68 (Thanks to Ross Gardler)
Applied patch for WOOKIE-69 (thanks to Ross Gardler for the patch); also fixed a classpath problem when using MySQL with clean-db task
Changed to match the default unsupported widget
Returns the correct message to the user when an email is successfully sent (this was previously the id for 'no operation could be ascertained')

Applied patch for WOOKIE-41 to enable emails to be sent with authentication; it also requires Apache Commons Email, which has been added to the ivy.xml file. (Thanks to Ross Gardler for the patch ... and sorry for taking so long to apply it!)

Implemented support for two additional widget properties specified in W3C: AuthorEmail and AuthorHref, and updated conformance tests to latest version at http://samaxes.svn.beanstalkapp.com/widgets_compatibility_matrix/trunk/index.html
added some more digits to the "invalid widget id" test case, as with more W3C conf tests we can now end up with more than 99 widgets installed when running tests!

Implemented REST API for Services (categories) as defined at http://incubator.apache.org/wookie/wookie-rest-api.html plus included PUT, POST and DELETE methods requiring "widgetadmin" privileges. As part of this implementation I also generalized the REST controller into a new base class (Controller) with standardised exceptions for typical REST exceptions and their HTTP codes, and refactored the WidgetsController to make use of it. A set of JUnit tests has also been included for the new API.
Fixed a typo in widget ID
Changed the "Instantiate Widget" form to show a list of installed widgets rather than service types. See also WOOKIE-71.
Placed a guard against null values when processing Href properties of Author elements in config.xml
Removing our original W3C test cases - the official ones from W3C now offer a lot more coverage and are being externally maintained

Implemented widget icons as a separate class rather than a single "widgeticonlocation" property of widget, added processing rules from W3C Widgets specification that identify default icons, and added processing rules for locating icons in localization folders. Also implemented conformance tests that cover icons. This corrects most of the issues in WOOKIE-58. Note that there are two problem areas remaining with this changeset: (1) GadgetUtils no longer supports icons; this should be resolved as part of the Shindig integration task; (2) the JSP pages still refer to a singular non-localized widget icon location; I've implemented a temporary method to cover this usage for now (and marked it deprecated) - this can be looked at when improving JSP localization.

Altered the algorithm for processing Preference entries in config.xml to better conform to W3C Spec by skipping invalid and duplicate entries, and treating readOnly attributes in a case-sensitive fashion - this fixes WOOKIE-59

Implemented support for License element in Widget as a separate bean class; also included bidirectional text support, and implemented associated conformance tests. License is now also displayed in widget metadata (e.g. GET /wookie/widgets/) to enable conformance testing. However we may wish to limit this in future releases to reduce potential vulnerabilities (e.g. malicious code embedded in license text) - I'll create a new issue for this one.

Corrected problems with processing <feature> elements (see WOOKIE-62) and completed the conformance tests for features. These currently require manual enabling and checking, as its not possible (nor desirable) to expose this information via API. All W3C tests for Feature elements now pass.
Removed the empty string check on Preference.name as this is done in its superclass already.
Added ASF license header
Added ASF 2.0 license headers to core web content (jsp, html, css) - see WOOKIE-81

This is a partial fix for WOOKIE-64 that encloses scripts in CDATA sections during parsing, and which are then removed when the widget is saved. This gets rid of the problem of escaping of script content.
Switched location of test case widgets to W3C main server, and corrected some test cases: the errors I reported to W3C were confirmed, and so we now pass most of the remaining icon tests.
fix for WOOKIE-81 - added an XmlUtils class with getTextContent() which recursively adds text nodes from child elements to the return String.
Implemented IRI attribute checking, fixing WOOKIE-60, WOOKIE-77 and WOOKIE-78
Applied patch for WOOKIE-74 and WOOKIE-83, updating the widget template and build script to better conform to W3C. Thanks to Ross Gardler for the patch, and to Markus Essl for reporting the issue.
Added a missing test case

Refactored the PropertiesController to use the abstract Controller base class, implemented the delete method, and added a new suite of functional tests that checks calls to the Properties API. Implementing this required some small changes to Controller, and a new UnauthorizedAccessException class to flag authn issues. The core business methods of the PropertiesController are reused by WidgetAdminServlet and WidgetServiceServlet, and so these needed to be updated to reflect the changes.
Put guard to prevent null pointer exceptions when checking parameters
Fix POST to only return a 201 when a resource is actually created; return 200 if successfully executes without creating a new resource (e.g. if update by POST is allowed)
Omit empty values for short name and author in XML output (i.e. don't print "null" as a string)
Refactored Participants API impl to use the Controller base class and for both ParticipantsController and WaveAPIImpl to share a single Helper class for representing participants in XML and JSON.
Implemented test case "ds" - this currently fails due to the encoding issue also affecting most of the other remaining test cases
Changed the default Shortname and Version to be returned as Null rather than to use special Wookie defaults, as this is the expected behaviour in the W3C spec.
Updated conformance tests "bl" and "bm" as per W3C as discussed under WOOKIE-58 - our error report was accepted, and we now pass these two tests.

Added the basic "plumbing" for a full l10n implementation as specified by WOOKIE-67 and WOOKIE-79, including the core utils class and its test cases, plus interfaces and required libraries. This stage adds no new functionality; this will follow in subsequent changesets.
Added ICU4J license to license list
Suppressed type safety warnings from test cases
Encode test URL string - as on Tomcat this would result in a 505 error.
Checked for null and empty values and consistent output from localization util methods, and added additional test cases

This is a major changeset that adds support for localization of widgets, included localized start files, icons, names, licenses, and descriptions which can  be selected either using system default locales or by using a "locale" parameter REST API methods. This changeset affects database structure, beans, controllers, and the widget processing model. This fixes WOOKIE-79 and addresses many of the concerns of WOOKIE-67.

Fixed processing of charsets and content types for widget startfiles, and added a servlet filter to encode all Wookie content as UTF-8. This changeset enables Wookie to pass conformance tests e4,e5,e6,e7,z1,z2 on Tomcat; a bug in the version of Jetty currently being used in Wookie prevents the filter working properly at present (see JETTY-837) however this is fixed in later Jetty releases.
Added content-type checks for images to determine if an icon is of a supported image type; this fixes WOOKIE-80.

Fixed an issue with localization caused by a default locale value of "" rather than NULL for localized elements, fixed another problem in the algorithm for obtaining the default localized element, and added more unit tests to check for these conditions.
Fixed incorrect loading of supported locales
fixed issue with language preference for instances not being persisted
Catch and log exceptions thrown from underlying icu4j implementation, added more javadoc, and exposed the locale list processing method as Public for reuse in other localization code.
Set the language tag of default start files and icons using the method for identifying locale folder names.

Locates all valid files for default icons and start files; before this fix only the first valid file found was added to the list, however for instance level localization we need to include all valid file sets for each supported locale.

Fix for WOOKIE-92 (part of WOOKIE-67) which adds an optional locale parameter to the API method for obtaining a widget instance. If the locale value is a valid language tag, it is stored with the widget instance, and is used to determine the start file URL returned. Functional tests are provided along with a localized widget to support the tests. If no locale is set, the default server locale is used instead.
More localization test improvements, plus fallback behaviour for start files in rare cases (e.g. no matching localized version and no non-localized default version)

Fix for WOOKIE-94 (part of WOOKIE-67) implementing folder-based localization using a servlet filter. Includes test cases. Note that this does slow down a Wookie server as all static resource requests get intercepted, so we should also look into caching or other performance optimisation methods for this solution.
Applied patch for WOOKIE-28 (thanks to Ross Gardler for the patch) - this adds a "demo" link to the widget gallery view that opens a preview instance of the widget.

Updated the NotSupported widget to use folder-based localization, and added support to the controller to ensure the default widget gets a language tag whenever it is instantiated (only transitively). Also added the startfiles to the DB scripts. See WOOKIE-97 for more details.
Fix that removes the hibernate config warnings described in WOOKIE-82.
Fixed typo in algorithm - thanks to Cyril Concolato for catching this one
Removed injected scripts from Widget sources - see WOOKIE-84

Applied patch for WOOKIE-87 which improves the widget template (Thanks to Ross Gardler for the patch). While checking this over I noticed a few widgets using the deprecated uid attribute rather than id so I've updated these. Wookie's parser is quite lax and does check for uid if no id attribute is found, but its better to use the correct attribute for spec conformance and interoperability with other W3C implementations.

Altered the IFeature interface to be a bit more flexible and less tied into DWR - now just returns the feature IRI, array of scripts to include and array of stylesheets to include when processing using the StartPageJSParser.
Applied patch for WOOKIE-72 removing exception trapping and enabling exceptions to output directly to the log/console. (Thanks to Ross Gardler for the patch).
Added missing ASF license header
Added a description to the Run ant target
Created unit tests for the IRI Validator
Added license header

This changeset refactors the injection mechanism for start files, and implements a custom serializer for HtmlCleaner that omits event handler attributes from escaping as well as script tags and stylesheets;this fixes WOOKIE-102 and WOOKIE-64. Two sets of unit tests have also been added for the new classes. Hopefully the new implementation is easier to understand as well as fixing the issues; there is also scope for replacing HTMLCleaner with alternative implementations such as Neko or JTidy using the IHtmlProcessor interface.
Included author info in the widget metadata sent to widget at runtime.

Added W3C Widget Interface conformance test suite. Currently this will load the test widgets, create instances, and then add an iframe link for each to an output HTML page to "eyeball" the results. It sort of works in a crude way; it already identifies a few issues we need to look at.
Implemented exception handling using window.DOMException as per W3C Widget Interface spec
Committing patch for WOOKIE-86 allowing port to be configured when running server in standalone mode (thanks to Ross Gardler for the patch)

Added loading of features based on the content of a feature.properties file at server startup. This looks up features based on IRI and classname and adds them to the DB. Tests are included, as is the default feature.properties file. This removes the necessity for setting up features directly in SQL and so the relevant line has been removed from each of the DB setup scripts. This changeset implements WOOKIE-99.
Replaced corrupted character in test case with correct UTF-8 char.
Corrected project name and local repository name - this should fix issue WOOKIE-109
Moved the hot-deploy watcher to the end of the init process, otherwise it can get into a race with the Feature loader
Implemented the submitValue(key, value) method as defined in the Google Wave Gadgets spec
Changed the wrapper to return the height and width parameters of the widget as integers (this enables us to pass W3C TWI tests "ao" and "ap")
Corrected location of two of the W3C TWI conformance test packages
Added the shortName property to the widget runtime metadata; this enables us to pass TWI test "ak". See also WOOKIE-20

Changed the demoWidget function to also include the proxy information in the URL, so that the Weather widget (and others using remote services) can be tested from the gallery view. This required making CheckProxy() public and return the String form of the proxy URL for the request, and adding the proxy URL to the response attributes.
Added a new conformance test just published by W3C (Wookie passes it OK)
Implemented another conformance test just added by W3C to the P&C spec (Wookie passes)

Changed the behaviour of preferences such that a request for a non-existing preference returns undefined instead of null; also calling clear or removeItem on a preference deletes it rather than setting it to null. This enables us to pass the "au" conformance test for W3C Widgets: Widget Interface (see http://dev.w3.org/2006/waf/widgets-api/test-suite/)
use apache namespace for widget template
remove explicit inclusion common.css in new widgets
don't filter binary files in the widget template (FIXES Wookie-101)
Make it easier to build and deploy widgets. we can now deploy to a running instance of Wookie using ANT
Provide a default icon for new widgets. This is a copy of the Wookie logo (would be nice for it to be SVG then we could flash the name of the widget across the icon).
Use screen.css instead of common.css for default styling
Allow a local properties file to override build properties.
Use default Maven repo as well as the local files provided by Wookie
Fix invalid XML

Throws a more friendly error message if the user has forgotten to run clean-db first. This addresses WOOKIE-88
A simple tutorial taking the user through the steps required to build your first widget.
Adds all scripts to the user scripts collection when parsing the page, not just those with a src attribute; this addresses issue WOOKIE-113. Also added a testcase for it.
Report an error if someone runs a target from the wrong directory.
Added the "sharedraw" widget from the OSSWatch widget training day. This is a little collaborative drawing app that demonstrates how to use the HTML 5 Canvas feature with shared data.

Updated the proxy service code to handle POST requests and BASIC AUTH (Thanks to Henning Eriksson for the patch). This fixes WOOKIE-116. Also made some changes to make the servlet easier to run tests against (such as using standard HTTP error codes rather than custom error messages), and added some test cases.
A few usability enhancements to the Butterfly widget (thanks to Samantha Wilson, age 4, for the suggestions :-)

Fixed a problem reported for WOOKIE-116 reported by Aaron Duley, whereby a formdata request results in an illegal state (STREAMED) error. This is caused by accessing parameters (which calls an InputStream) and a Reader to read content on the same request/response. I've changed the "sendXMLData" code and added more test cases to check behaviour. I've also made parts of the proxy code return more meaningful exception types to make debugging easier.
Added test cases for POST with no parameters (only querystring) and for GET with parameters (both encoded and unencoded)
Modified proxy server to try to decode all URLs rather than use as fallback behaviour - see WOOKIE-118
Modified proxy client to pass through POST parameters as well as POST body, and added more test cases. See WOOKIE-118 for more details.
Ensure correct content-type is set in the prox'd request, and returned in the proxy'd response; added more test cases to check this. See WOOKIE-118 for more details

Implemented a system for dynamically building and deploying Features; this uses the same approach as the Widgets build system, but also compiles the Feature core java classes and deploys them as part of the built codebase. The Bondi Camera API feature is provided as an example feature. See WOOKIE-99 for more information.
Added a webcam widget to demo the BONDI camera API feature
Added Camera feature to default feature set
Added a small hack for proxified URLs encoded using JQuery - see WOOKIE-118
Use a flag to indicate we are deploying to a dev server otherwise test failed when deploying locally
Provide more useful context information for authentication exceptions
Implemented the Access element as per the W3C WARP spec draft at http://www.w3.org/TR/widgets-access/
Removed dependency on Sun Base64 encoder with Apache Commons Codec. See WOOKIE-106
Fix location of commons-email; see WOOKIE-106
removed old-style "access" element from template - this should now follow the W3C WARP spec if included.
Changed access element in weather widget config.xml to conform to W3C WARP
A couple of log messages about invalid API keys
Improved support for RTL text in widget catalogue information using the "dir" attribute for license, description, name. (Still missing from Author)

Implemented W3C WARP spec (see WOOKIE-85). This automatically adds access request beans for widgets based on the content of the <access> element in config.xml. These are granted by default if the widget is deployed to the local deploy folder, but otherwise are not granted. There is currently however no UI for administrators to grant or revoke these access requests. Note that this update includes a database schema change to add a new table for AccessRequest.
Removed redundant "addwhitelistentry" method from WidgetAdminManager - this is already implemented directly in the admin servlet
Put null guards in place when checking for ITS properties on widget metadata
Renamed "WidgetFactory" to "WidgetInstanceFactory", as that's what it actually is.

Refactored some of the admin methods into static factories WidgetFactory and WidgetInstanceFactory to make the code easier to understand by keeping concerns together. Longer term I think the WidgetAdminManager can eventually be removed completely.
Add version number to jar file [FIXES WOOKIE-108]
Proxy now only decodes URLs where attempting to parse the URL fails; see WOOKIE-118 for details (and thanks to Raido and Sander for pointing this out)
Initial connector framework for Java. This is incomplete and not fully tested. I'm committing now in order to encourage feedback and contributions.
fix name of artifact when publishing locally

Fixed an error whereby requests to delete non-existing Preferences instead created them (see WOOKIE-123 - thank Raido for the report). This was due to not checking whether the value being assessed for a preference was null; this issue was not present in the SharedData code.

Fix for WOOKIE-124 - Jetty was failing due to a classloader issue caused by the Jetty packages being loaded using different Ivy configurations. I've fixed this by making all Jetty dependencies fit in the "dev" configuration.

Updated widgets to use the current localization model and removed dependencies on shared language helper and util JS in wookie-wrapper.js (see WOOKIE-97). This means that there are fewer objects in the global space - just the Widget object itself - and that wookie-wrapper.js is much smaller and loads faster.

Added a "flash message" facility that notifies admins when widgets have been dropped into the deploy folder, and any errors that occurred, when they visit the admin index page. See WOOKIE-70 for more information.
Added:

This is part 1 of 3 updates of the Shindig integration code that brings it up to date with the other changes to the Wookie core code; while not everything works as it should, it is now possible to integrate Wookie and Shindig once more as two cooperating webapps by following the instructions in the README. Currently only plain tokens can be used and so I've set this as the default in opensocial.properties; there is a problem creating valid encrypted tokens. See WOOKIE-52 for more information on wookie-shindig integration.
This is part 2 of 3 updates of the Shindig integration code that brings it up to date with the other changes to the Wookie core code; See WOOKIE-52 for more information on wookie-shindig integration.
This is part 3 of 3 updates of the Shindig integration code that brings it up to date with the other changes to the Wookie core code; See WOOKIE-52 for more information on wookie-shindig integration.

OK I miscounted :-) this is part 4 of 3 updates of the Shindig integration code that brings it up to date with the other changes to the Wookie core code; See WOOKIE-52 for more information on wookie-shindig integration.
Excluded juel-api module from Ivy dependencies - this is requested by Shindig but conflicts with Tomcat's EL API
Corrected test case URL.

Made a number of improvements to Shindig integration: (1) moved gadget-widget conversion into a GadgetAdapter class that implements W3CWidget and takes a JSON object as its constructor, (2) gadget import generates a W3CWidget model object and doesn't do any persistence itself, this is left to the WidgetFactory class as is usual for other widget imports, (3) Doesn't import duplicate gadgets, (4) updated unit tests. See WOOKIE-52 for details.
Made UI for adding a gadget consistent with other admin pages. See WOOKIE-52.
Prevents Ivy from caching local subproject jars; this may not necessarily be the "right" way to do this, but it does seem to do the trick.

Implemented support in the parser for content using i18n features, including the dir attribute on elements, and the <span> element in element content, according to the new i18n algorithms published in http://dev.w3.org/2006/waf/widgets/ and added unit tests for new methods.
Added a space to separate some attributes in Widget XML representations  - this was causing some XML parsing issues
Partial fix for IE 8.  Wookie wrapper now does not produce an error alert when defining getters/setters, although the setter does not propagate the updates back to the wookie backend. See WOOKIE-44
minor fix to allow widget to run on IE8
Added a few fixes so widget now works in IE 8

Applied the Notifications patch as described in WOOKIE-65. This filters notifications sent to widgets using Comet to ensure that only sibling instances (different user, same context, same widget URI) are notified of each other's changes to shared data/state. A hook is provided for other kinds of notifications (e.g. same user/context but different widget URI) to be implemented.
Cleaned up the functional tests using a single set of constants to make it easier to configure the tests to run on different servers, ports etc.

Added an admin web interface for granting and revoking Widget Access Request Policies and linked it to the main admin page. Functionality is implemented with a web API rather than built directly into an admin servlet to enable development of remote admin client tools. See WOOKIE-85 and WOOKIE-122 for more information.
Added some server diagnostics (see WOOKIE-130) that generate messages when widget deploy, upload and wservices folder don't exist, can't be read from, or can't be written to.
Removed the "isMaximize" property from Widgets, from DB scripts, and from the admin interface.

Conduct additional input validation on the W3CWidgetFactory, throwing exceptions for missing or read-only output directories, and invoke methods on WidgetPackageUtils using a File rather than a path String for the widget output folder. Also added more comments.
Added test cases for the W3CWidgetFactory

Added conformance tests for the parser; these are the same test cases that we run against the Wookie server, but in this case are evaluating the W3CWidget object created by the parser, rather than what gets served out by Wookie when running as a servlet. This is important as we need to make sure that the parser is behaving correctly when it gets used by other kinds of applications.
Added a missing test clause for default view mode
Added test cases for parser methods not covered elsewhere, such as various additional constructors, getters, setters, defaults and so on in the model classes for widgets.

Replaced reference to antlr StringUtils with commons-lang StringUtils, and removed direct dependency on Antlr from parser and main project. (This was probably just a case of Eclipse auto-importing the wrong StringUtils class.)

Added the capability for the parser to process widgets by providing a URL instead of a File; the parser downloads widgets using HttpClient and checks for the "application/widget" MIME type. (Added W3C conformance tests Z3,Z4,Z5 - which test this behaviour - to the test cases)

Enables a client to request an existing widget instance with a different locale, and for this updated locale to be persisted for the instance (see WOOKIE-135 for more details); also added a test case for the new behaviour.

Allow setting supported character encodings for the W3CWidgetFactory in the same manner as setting supported locales, and added supporting tests. This is important as otherwise there is no way to specify a set of supported encodings for the parser other than editing the IW3CXMLConfiguration constants.

I refactored several of the methods in WidgetPackageUtils in the Parser sub-project into a new WidgetFileUtils class in the main project. The reason for this is that these methods are not used internally in the parser at all, and are utility methods used by the Wookie server for uploading, moving and deleting widget files.

Fixed a silly bug where catching a problem locating a key didn't result in actually doing anything. Also changed the method signature from "id" to "value" to match how its invoked. Finally a couple of documentation and formatting improvements.

Merging in the Pluggable Persistence branch into the Wookie trunk. This replaces the Hibernate persistence mechanism with a new pluggable framework developed by Randy Watler (thanks Randy!) that has implementations using JPA and JCR, with the possibility of adding other persistence options in the future.

Fixed a conformance problem with the ViewModes implementation - I've updated the list of supported modes to be in tune with the latest spec at http://www.w3.org/TR/view-mode/ and put some checking in WidgetManifestModel to ensure unsupported modes aren't simply copied over when processing the manifest file.

Fixed an error in the algorithm that determines if there is a text direction override on a localizable element; it was returning LTR for the root element (<widget>) rather than checking it first and returning LTR only if there is also no override on the root.

Modified the parser to model the Author as a localizable object with an optional its:dir property - see WOOKIE-119. This also affects the API the parser exposes to the Wookie server. I haven't changed the model managed by the server itself however, only the classes that map from the parser model to beans used by the server (WidgetFactory, GadgetAdaptor).

Changed the implementation of charset overrides for widget start pages. Setting the response type for a GET has no effect on the server at all and it will use the default setting (UTF-8 on Tomcat; ISO on Jetty). So instead I've changed the StartPageProcessor to inject a <meta http-equiv="Content-Type"> tag into the <head> of the start page with the encoding and type overrides from the Widget's <content> element. This addresses issue WOOKIE-93.

Initial commit of Flatpack feature (see WOOKIE-182) with some tests to show how the code works. This is early days - still to do are persisting links between Widget objects and their original .wgt archives, handling flattened Features, and the API & UI for exposing the capability to clients
Exclude flatpack tests from post-compile-core - they need to be run after building the sample Widgets

Modified the Widget model and also the WidgetFactory so that when adding a Widget a reference to its .wgt archive file is retained. This is part of the changes needed to support WOOKIE-182. Note that we do not at present guarantee that an uploaded.wgt is never overridden by another upload of a different widget with the same filename, which is something that needs to be fixed.
Use the .wgt reference to locate the input file, and also generate a good filename using RandomGUID. See WOOKIE-182

Created a controller and tests for Flatpack (See WOOKIE-182). I've also implemented some very basic security features (can't request a package URL without a valid API key, can't get access to the directory listing they're contained in, hard-to-guess filenames).

Added methods for getting unicode encoded versions of strings for presentation models that don't use HTML <span> tags, using the algorithm presented in the current W3C Widgets Interface spec (see http://dev.w3.org/2006/waf/widgets-api/#getting-localizable-strings-). This contributes to both WOOKIE-20 and WOOKIE-128
Switched two JSP scripts to UTF-8 and use a helper method for getting unicode Widget titles; this addresses issue WOOKIE-178.
Changed the URL pattern for the export servlet in web.xml - Jetty was fine with using an extension pattern, but Tomcat doesn't like it
move widget template into a subdirectory and allow user to request a type of widget template to use (another template coming in a subsequent commit)
add a wave widget template
can't have spaces in possible values, and it helps to have a default value
remove username code - not used in the basic widget template
update to represent the current widget template system
split the tutorial into two, the first is hello world, the second looks at using javascript libraries and settings
Use a more useful default width
Use a more useful default width
Add a template for jqueryMobile widgets
width and height defaults were swapped
No need to define CSS class, jQuery handles that for us.
A simple RSS reader using JQueryMobile (it works in desktop browsers too)
Allow all widget variables to be defiend from the command line or config file

Added content-type sniffing for images used as icons - see WOOKIE-80 - this involves reading the first few bytes of unidentified files to see if they match the patterns for GIF, JPG, ICO, PNG, and BMP formats.

Fix for WOOKIE-169. The bug was caused by the script only listening to keyup events - the auto-complete function in the browser doesn't trigger it, but does trigger the change() event, so I've bound the validation action to both events. (Note:I also changed the input type to "email". This doesn't really make any difference except to iPhone and Opera users, who get a nicer interface)
Ensure that metadata returned from the Widget Instance REST API has the localized title for the locale specified in the request
Put the flatpack handler and exported files handler on separate paths so that both Jetty and Tomcat are happy. (See WOOKIE-182)
Updated icu4j to latest version. Hopefully this will resolve the intermittent exception I've seen with getting locale tags (see e.g. WOOKIE-156)
add a link  from the hello page to the home page remove a class attribute (these are managed by JQuery)
Don't require deploy-widget to be run from root directory. This was confusing users since the seed-widget is done from the widgets directory.
removed some unused methods from the widget exporter
Add a note that readers need to be able to build a hello world wiget first
Remove my name as author - now just the Wookie dev team
remove antcall to another target, with recent changes this no longer needs to be a separate call.
remove a data-theme attribute, stick with the standard theme
Gave the Freeder widget "global origin" permission and removed the "URL must be whitelisted" message - it now works straight away.
Added JQuery Mobile feature; this adds a patched version of the JQuery Mobile JS libraries and CSS to a Widget - see the README in the feature for more details
Replaced the script and css imports with the JQuery mobile feature for the jqueryMobile template and Freeder widget
Also override the history.back button in dialogs as well as pages
Make sure the Freeder widget gets the right form input - though it still won't refresh properly yet

Quite a few changes: I've made the Settings page into a modal dialog, made a single Detail page rather than spawn new pages on viewing entries, got the Properties working more reliably, and fixed a weird refresh bug
Implemented transitions for back functions (this needs to be replicated over to Ross's Github fork...)
Put the settings header back in (now that the close button works properly)
simplified the JQM template using the code currently working in the Freeder widget
use icu4j to 4.6.0 since 4.2.1 was removed in r1078759
More useful error reporting and logging - tell us what the actual problem is.
remove overflow:hidden as it prevents the iframe scrolling
A template to dynamic settings handling. Simply define your settings in the SettingsService.getGroups and SettingsService.getSettings methods and this will auto construct your settings forms for you.
Added JSON support to the WARP controller

Added a client API for the Whitelist admin functions. See https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WOOKIE/Wookie+Admin+REST+API for information on how to use this with an admin client. Combined with the WARP API this starts to decouple the administration interface of Wookie from the built-in JSP/servlets so we can use Widgets to manage a Wookie server instance using any kind of container.
Added a scratchpad for widgets
Added readme for scratchpad
Added a widget I've used for testing for basic JQuery issues like document.ready
Added some widgets that perform admin functionality - managing the whitelist and policy entries. These can be used instead of the admin JSP pages.
This widget can be used to bulk/batch test the setting of preferences and shared data - useful for seeing what happens when the queueing mechanism is enabled in wookie

Added the ability to POST a .wgt file to /widgets/ to upload a new widget. By default using this API requires admin rights. See issue WOOKIE-98
make it clear we are building on the hello world widget. Thanks to Simon booth. See WOOKIE-184

Use a default config + local config files. This means we can now add properties to widgetserver.properties without breaking users installs (see Wookie-187)
- Add remote files to wookie (need to add images yet) - rename jqmobile file to make it clear we have patched it - rename licence files to follow convention

Implemented updating of widgets including any changes in config.xml - previously Wookie just overwrote files in the package but did not update any of the widget metadata, resulting in some odd "caching" type behaviour as changes to things like height and width wouldn't "take".
Add eclipse code style and code templates.
load local properties before setting any ivy properties so that they may be overridden
Ignore a few more local files
add s5 widget to seed-widget target
whitespace only (preparing to explore the damned Ant 1.8 issue)
ANT 1.8 requires us to provide an absolute path when using imported files. Fixes Wookie-152. Thanks to Michael Aherne.

Added a custom icon for Freeder widget
Features build file modified to also work with portable version of Wookie - thanks to Martin Hawksey for the fix. See WOOKIE-152 for more details.
Removed directive to prevent directory listing from web.xml (see WOOKIE-192) and instead add an index.html file to /exports when its first created. Also updated functional test.
Set the encoded parameters test to @ignore as its not actually a useful test case
Escape XML output for things like widget names to remove angle brackets etc.
Updated list of TWI conformance tests - still some more to add in yet
Don't unnecessarily add BIDI tags to strings if they are all LTR or have no direction info (and updated tests)

correct deploy message
Improve formatting
add installation docs as an s5 presentation packaged as a widget. You can view these without running in Wookie by opening index.html

Return widget metadata using i18n encoded strings. See WOOKIE-204.

Removed mac specific settings - See WOOKIE-193.
Make sure widget titles are escaped when returning XML for widget instances
Minor change to localization tests to reflect content of current icu4j language sets

Adding as per request in WOOKIE-195.
Check for localized instances using escaped XML text rather than UTF-8 characters
Fixed test case - had changed at W3C
treat "ltr" as default for encoding - so if a string has no embedded direction information and has dir=ltr, just return the plain string
More test cases for formatting i18n strings
Updated patch for IE concerning meta-data attributes which are read-only. SEE WOOKIE-205.

Corrected the handling of default text direction of i18n text to reflect both W3C P&C and TWI specifications. Rather than always return "LTR" as a default we allow NULL and then follow the algorithm for not using unicode escape characters for NULL direction. This gets us much closer to TWI conformance. Also updated our unit tests to reflect this behaviour change.
Added remaining TWI tests (see WOOKIE-204)
Ensure that we always return a number for "width" and "height" widget attributes and never NULL, as required by the TWI spec. See WOOKIE-204. If there is no value, we return 0.
Caught two more instances of not properly escaping XML text content
removed unused variable

Updated the weather widget to better conform to W3C: renamed "Widget" to "widget", added a white background, fixed the service URL to avoid a redirect, and only call proxify() if the function exists (i.e., its in Wookie and not another widget engine like Opera)
Updated some of the weather types to avoid broken images
Updated one of the functional tests - the BBC weather feed URL changed, and though I'd updated the Widget I hadn't updated this test.
Don't enable Shindig by default in opensocial.properties; this property also now determines whether the "add gadget" menu option appears in the admin inteface.See WOOKIE-194.

Refactored to remove a lot of code relating SharedData and Participants directly to Widgets and WidgetInstances and replaced with a single "SharedDataHelper" service facade to manage all access to shared data - this means we consistently manage the relationship via the internal shared data key which is constructed in a single way. See WOOKIE-206.
Removed more redundant code missed by the previous changeset
Fixed named queries and JCR configuration (now passes JCR tests fine) and removed unnecessary imports

Removed the "convenience" methods for getting shared data from the Widget and WidgetInstance beans and replaced with accessing the SharedDataHelper facade - this is mainly to make sure all access to shared data uses the same method so we can simplify the data model more easily, but also as it cuts out a fair amount of boilerplate code that has to be implemented across both the JPA and JCR persistence frameworks.
Destroy shared data and participants consistently when deleting a widget

Implemented the W3C conformance tests for the Widget-Updates spec at the parser level; also updated the UDD parser to catch bad HTTP codes and content-types using HTTPClient to retrieve the UDD rather than let JDOM swallow them. See WOOKIE-103. Note that some tests fail or generate errors at the moment - I've reported these to W3C as possible test problems.
Added missing license header
Added support for relative URLs for widget update locations
Added an UpdateUtils class, with utility methods for working with widget updates - checking for available updates, and acquiring updated widget packages over the network

Updated tests to use UpdateUtils where appropriate, for example to test acquiring updated widget packages, and implemented remaining tests that can be conducted using just the parser. I've also flagged the tests that need to also be implemented in the server for functional testing once we add update support to it.
Removed some debugging statements

Added support for supplying a "default identifier" when parsing a widget package. This is important for the Widget Updates feature (see WOOKIE-103), as the updated widget may not contain an identifier element, or may have one that differs from the original for some reason, however we need to ensure the correct folders are written to with the new content.
Removed another debug statement
Removed unused method
Added an "updateLocation" property to IWidget, which is used to store the location of a widget's update site (see WOOKIE-103).
Added toXML serialization for Update Description Documents (see WOOKIE-103)

Added a controller and helper classes for Widget Updates (see WOOKIE-103). This provides an admin-only REST-like API for managing updates; you can get a list of available updates, trigger individual updates, or trigger all updates. This could be used to create an admin user interface.
Added conformance tests for Widget Updates (see WOOKIE-103) and refactored the conformance tests to reuse a common set of utility methods
improved javadoc and comments in updates classes

Fixed a big problem with the solution to WOOKIE-206 I committed earlier, which is that the new SharedDataHelper wasn't being used in the WidgetInstancesController - causing duplicate widget instances.

As we now use the same internal form of shared data key for widget instances there is no need to compute the value of it, but simply return the value. However, its useful keeping this indirection for a while we make sure the fix for WOOKIE-206 doesn't have any other problems.

Updated Shindig connector to work with Shindig 2.0.0 (see WOOKIE-170). I've also modified the Ivy configuration so that only the very small subset of dependencies from Shindig actually required by Wookie are explicitly named and included in the deployment, as some of the downstream dependencies that we don't use can cause conflicts with the servlet container, and a lot of other jars simply aren't needed. I've tested this with Shinding 2.0.0 on Tomcat 6.0.20.
Implemented XML-based feature loading as described in WOOKIE-210
Updated features to use new XML-based feature loading (see WOOKIE-210)
removing unused src folders missed in last commit
Refactoring scratchpad features to use new loading method (see WOOKIE-210)
Removing empty folders
adding back in OSAPI test widget into scratchpad/widgets
Simplified the build and deployment process for features, and added properties to the build.properties file to select which feature sets are included when deploying Wookie.
Added an admin web API for managing API keys (see WOOKIE-208). However, there are some issues to resolve around API key migration and so PUT support is not currently enabled.
Removed schemas directory; these are no longer used as we take the spec and test cases directly from W3C.
Removed reference to features/camera/src which was removed as part of WOOKIE-210 (thanks to Ate Douma for spotting this)
Updated build scripts so that sets of widgets (extras, scratchpad) can be deployed as part of a build using build properties, in exactly the same manner as features
Fixed a minor test bug and added some more tests to improve test coverage
Improved the consistency of the APIs between parser and server core object classes.
Missed file from last commit
Removing unused jar; the newer version (4.6) can be obtained by Ivy

Adding in the latest jar; icu4j isn't available from a repository yet. The parser has been using the copy in the main Wookie project, however this needs to be here to enable a separate build of the parser without its parent project.
Separated out JCR persistence implementation from the core server into a separate module and added a decoupled loader mechanism.
Updated versions for distributions to 0.9.1-SNAPSHOT and changed the module names to fit the more usual "wookie-module" convention rather than "wookieModule" camel-case style.
Removed a test case that was removed from the official W3C test suite
Fixed a potential issue in the parser with double-encoding XML content, particularly nested text nodes, when recursively extracting text from localized text fields.
Added simplified method for formatting bidi overrides that also works for nested <span> tags.
Implemented defaultLocale support methods in Localization Utils, and added a hack so we can run the W3C defaultlocale test suite. See WOOKIE-211.
Added defaultLocale attribute to the W3C parser module, and changed localization calls to use it. See WOOKIE-211.
Added defaultLocale test cases, and changed utility methods to use defaultLocale. See WOOKIE-211.
Added "defaultLocale" to the Widget bean and updated the JPA and JCR implementations. See WOOKIE-211.
Updated WidgetHelper to use defaultLocale. See WOOKIE-211.
Updated calls to localizationUtils to use defaultLocale attribute. See WOOKIE-211.
Updated calls to localizationUtils to use defaultLocale attribute. See WOOKIE-211.
Switched the previous set of localizationUtils methods from deprecated to protected - they are still used, but not intended for use outside the LocalizationUtils class. See WOOKIE-211.
Added a missing W3C test case

Implemented DefaultLocale processing for folder-based localization - see WOOKIE-211. Whenever the server has a request for a resource, if no localized version is available for the specified user locale, and no non-localized resource is available, we now check for a resource using the Widget's defaultLocale attribute as a final resort.

Added deprecation notices for legacy API methods for widgets that have been superseded by the W3C and Wave Gadget specs (e.g. widget.sharedDataForKey, widget.preferenceForKey) and extended the syntax analyzer to generate warnings both for these and for any calls to the (undocumented) Wookie-specific extensions such as widget.show, widget.lock.
Removed two unused jars from ant/lib and from .classpath; these were part of Shindig dependencies but are no longer required.

Refactored the widget author information attributes into a new localized IAuthor interface to reflect the W3C spec (see WOOKIE-119). Existing methods for working with author information have been deprecated in IWidget - however the implementation provides a facade to support them. Implemented for both JPA and JCR backends.
Fixed a mistake in the JPA implementation of the Author property of a Widget that could lead to an erratic problem with object consistency when uploading losts of widgets at the same time.
Updated the set of W3C Widget Interface test cases to the current suite.
Updated WidgetFactory to use the new Author object, including localization properties (dir and lang). See WOOKIE-119.
Updated Widget AJAX API implementation to use the new Author object including localization; this means the correct encoded values are returned (see WOOKIE-204).
Implemented clear() method for Wave Gadget API. See WOOKIE-110. This is implemented client-side via submitDelta() rather than as a new server method.
Updated the WidgetInstance API, adding RESTful GET methods using a resource ID while preserving the legacy "getOrCreate" approach. See WOOKIE-34.
Added javadoc and comments

Removed the "WAC extensions" functionality in flatpack package - this is because WAC 2.0 uses exactly the same W3C Widget API already supported by Wookie. Also enabled use of resource paths as well as parameters to identify instances (same as widget instances API), and tidied up the javadoc comments.
replaced deprecated calls for widget author information
Ensure we actually set the value of defaultLocale and lang when installing a widget on the server - silly omission when implementing WOOKIE-211

Implemented two changes to the folder localization algorithm: (1) when receiving a request for a widget start page (including id key) don't skip the localization algorithm as the start file may be incorrectly localized, and (2) check for defaultLocale before checking non-localized resources, as per the W3C Widgets P&C spec
Fixed a few issues with the JCR module that were preventing it from building correctly
Committed first version of VTT closed-captioning HTML5 widget
added accessibility controls widget. Contributed by Mark Johnson (WOOKIE-218)
Added unit tests to show issue WOOKIE-217

Fix for WOOKIE-111. I've added widget.server.scheme/host/port properties to widgetserver.properties which you can use to override the defaults (based on current request context) and removed the wookie.port (etc) properties from build.properties as these aren't actually used for anything now, and are confusing.
remove duplication of run.args property (fixes wookie-221)

Added support in Flatpack  (see WOOKIE-182) for selective "flattening" of features. The test cases use JQuery Mobile - so when exporting Widgets that require JQM the relevant resources (js, css, images) are included in the exported .wgt package and the <feature> element removed from config.xml. The general approach is that features that are Wookie-specific conveniences/normalization for loading common libraries (like JQM) are flattened on export to improve interoperability. Features are flagged for this treatment by including a 'flatten="true"' attribute in feature.xml.

Several improvements to the Flatpack feature (see WOOKIE-182). (1) the controller uses the widgetserver properties to construct the return path for the exported .wgt rather than just the request (see WOOKIE-111). (2) feature resources are added once in the factory, not every time a start file is processed. (3) Improved code comments and formatting.
Implemented override for charset and content-type for existing meta tags; see WOOKIE-217
Changed name of hostname parameter as a fix for issue WOOKIE-244. Thanks to David del Pozo González for the patch.
Split the Widget runtime API into those that are used to implement the W3C standard API (IWidgetAPI) and Wookie extensions (IWookieExtensionAPI). See WOOKIE-225.
Made some small changes to make the widget work on non-wookie implementations: renamed references from Widget to widget, and check if proxify() method exists before trying to invoke it.
Load the Google Wave Gadget API Feature using the standard Feature loading system rather than as a "special case". This should make it simpler to swap out implementations of the Wave API in future.

Split the Wookie-specific extensions to the Widget object from the implementation of the W3C standard interface (see WOOKIE-225). This means that any widgets that want to use the non-standard extensions must include the wookie/ext feature in their config.xml. Note that the "setPreference..." method is included in IWidgetAPI - this is because we still need some sort of "post" mechanism in the Widget interface; this could be removed in future and replaced with a basic XHR operation, which would remove the need for DWR libraries in most widgets.

Updated JQuery Mobile feature to use release 1.0b1 as per WOOKIE-220. Note that as JQM no longer generates "back" buttons this meant updating a few widgets to create appropriate "home" links. We no longer need to create a special patched version as back/forward buttons are no longer generated by JQM - however it is no up to widget developers to put in appropriate navigation links. Note also this version claims support for IE 7-9, which also fixes WOOKIE-183.
Fixed a minor issue in a flatpack test case -  replaced a static string feature name with the actual installed features list.
Fixed the issue with using the wrong location (see WOOKIE-230) and added more code comments. Also created a set of unit tests for feature loading.
Adding test data files missed on last commit.
Added deprecation notices on core classes and interfaces providing Services functionality; see WOOKIE-215.
Removed a debug statement, and moved clearing of existing features into the main Load method so its called during testing as well as when invoked using the servlet context.

Improved the code comments in many of the unit tests, and removed individual developer credits from class javadoc. Also got rid of trapping of exceptions in test cases - instead just let them be thrown so we can debug it in the console.
Improved the code comments in more test classes. Also got rid of trapping of exceptions in test cases - instead just let them be thrown so we can debug it in the console.
Improved code comments and consistency in yet more test classes.

Cleaned up the Widget API implementation code and added more code comments to make it more readable. Also did a very small bit of refactoring for setting up accessor methods in one place rather than two - I've checked this against Safari, Opera and Firefox however it should also be checked with IE8 and IE9.

Added a very basic file download function for responding to a GET request for an exported widget instance ("flatpack"). This gets around various configuration issues associated with "default servlets" on different servlet containers (e.g. Jetty vs Tomcat) - see WOOKIE-231 and WOOKIE-182. Limitations in terms of security have also been noted in the code comments, and associated functional tests were also updated. Note that requests for flatpacks are now targeted at GET /flatpack/{id} and not /exports/{id}, but that exported files are still physically located in /exports - however the /exports folder itself is not published.

Improved code comments for widget upload, and conduct checks for valid .wgt files in the upload. Also added some basic functional tests (unauthorized upload, valid upload, upload with wrong type of file). Note that POSTing URLs rather than files (e.g. for Shindig gadgets) is not yet implemented.
Use composite configuration for opensocial properties, as per WOOKIE-187
Added more documentation to the SharedDataHelper facade, also added an assertion to catch unexpected duplicates in results for getting a single shared data object.

Replaced all direct access to WidgetInstance.getSharedDataKey with calls to the SharedDataHelper facade. This should eventually make it easier to  address WOOKIE-214 if it involves altering the internal shared data key format.
Added test case to make sure we handle shared data correctly, and to verify WOOKIE-206 remains fixed.
Updated wookie version number so its the same as in build.properties
New and refactored build release resources - similar to 0.9.0 version
Release file resources (as used in ant build-release task)
Added readme & release notes which were not present in the trunk.

In the build.properties file, if you have the "include.extra.features" commented out then the "features" folder does not seem to be created in the web app itself. If this is the case, then further down in this method a "featuresFolder.listFiles()" call can cause a null pointer exception. So to fix - if the folder doesn't exist, then exit.
Removed references to the  'widgety' appender. (should remove warnings about the log appender on startup)
Refactored generation of Wookie server URLs - pushed up to Controller from duplicate code in WidgetInstancesController and FlatpackController.
fixed indentation
Added support for a ?url parameter to the /widgets API for registering OpenSocial Gadgets (see WOOKIE-209), mirroring the capabilities of the admin UI.
No longer needed. See WOOKIE-233

Added a little fix in the create() method, where each fileitem was assumed to contain a name.  In the case of submitting a web form for example, the "submit" button becomes one of the items and does not always have a name attribute.  So we safety check to ensure its name is not null.
Minor tweak for DWR logging, now is more generic and doesn't refer to individual classes/packages.
Removed setOmitDocTypeDeclaration from HtmlCleaner - see WOOKIE-236
Added code comments
updated release notes for 0.9.1 with added KNOWN ISSUES entry for WOOKIE-222
Added draft "new and noteworthy" for 0.9.1
Implemented basic user thumbnail handling in Java connector framework (see WOOKIE-240)
Changed the default local Wookie server port to 8080, same as for the default configuration of the Standalone build, so as to hopefully avoid false negatives when testing. See WOOKIE-240.
Added "NEW_AND_NOTEWORTHY" file to release ant tasks so it gets distributed in all release artifacts. See WOOKIE-223
Added missing license headers for scratchpad content
Added S5 scripts to rat-ignore.txt and added an entry to NOTICE. These have been explicitly released into the public domain.

Commented out part of the persistence test that used a deprecated setAuthor() method as it has been causing build failures due to tests generating an exception. It doesn't indicate an actual code problem - the deprecated method redirects to the new implementation, but this won't work in the current transaction scope of the JPA tests. In future we could replace it with something, but it isn't critical as the other properties set by the test method adequately cover the test case.

minor tweak - the snapshot POM created from this file had the wrong revision id - changed now to 0.9.1-incubating-snapshot
updated ivy to retrieve v2.2.0 - which supports pom templates

Adding MySQL5 migration script for 0.9.0 to 0.9.1. See WOOKIE-237.

remove widget.deploy.dir from build.properties as it was interfering with widgets/build.xml and tidy up the widgets build a little. I've tested this and there seems to be no side effects. Added a check in the WidgetInstancesController for widget instances created by 0.9.0, and migrate them to 0.9.1 using a new MigrationHelper class.  This means that users upgrading from 0.9.0 to 0.9.1 should see no loss of data. See WOOKIE-243.

Refactored several of the methods from "SharedDataHelper", "PropertiesController" and "ParticipantsController" into a single model facade class, SharedContext, encapsulating the concerns of participants and shared data. As well as removing some odd dependencies (e.g. between controllers) and a further abstraction from the persistence layer, this provides a means for handling storage of shared data differently from other types of data (e.g. using nosql and/or cloud storage) and I think makes it a bit easier to understand the Wookie domain model.

I've removed the WARP tests as we use the spec in a slightly different way to how most mobile widget runtimes implement it, which is what the W3C test suite is aimed at. In Wookie we use WARP to add policies to a server-side proxy rather than to configure the webview in which the widget runs - in our case this is determined by the browser, not by us. So it doesn't really make sense to try and pass the standard WARP tests as these would mean doing some odd things to the browser that wouldn't make any sense for users. See WOOKIE-245.

Removed XSL transformation from the Browse template, and updated the Widget Browser example. I replaced the XSL transformation with simple token replacement using a HTML file as the detail template that the designer edits, and a list of elements and attributes in the widget properties file to use for replacing the tokens in the template. This is a lot less sophisticated than using XSL, but overcomes the issue of browser compatibility (See WOOKIE-297). For more complex replacement, the widget designer could override the actual JavaScript and put in some of their own rules. Note that the ItemDetail template still uses XSLT.

Use regex to find and replace all occurrences of a token in an item detail template when transforming data into HTML in the Browse template. (JavaScript replace by substring only uses the first match).

Split the maven folder into two child folders 'subprojects' and 'war'.  Under here all maven artifacts will use the license/notice files found under 'subprojects' - namely the connector, the parser and any -src, -doc zips created.  The maven war artifact is almost the same as the top level war, except that the maven war additionally needs to include the derby jar (and associated license/notice files) - hence why it now has it own folder.

Removed deprecated methods, and updated implementation to use AuthToken and SPIs
updated to use AuthToken and SPIs instead of PersistenceManager and IWidgetInstance

Removed the IWidgetInstance scaffold for SharedContext

Removing legacy helpers, and the WidgetInstanceFactory now that the job of IWIdgetInstance is done by AuthToken

Removed the support for OpenSocial gadgets - not only was this way behind spec, I think its much more obvious to run Wookie alongside Shindig rather than expect one or the other to handle both types of widget.
Removed unused method
Removed all remaining JPA hooks from server
Removed flatpack servlet as we've taken this out of 2.0
Removed JPA dependencies
commented out JPA module as we don't need this now to run a "basic" Wookie server
Added the Redis implementation of the preferences SPI
First commit of SharedContextService provider using Redis
Removed migration scripts as these are only relevant to the 1.x branch
Removed Ivy from Eclipse settings
added target folder and eclipse settings to svn:ignore

Added test cases for Redis shared data service, and updated implementation to fix a few errors, notably failing to release the jedis resource on a couple of logic branches, and catching all nulls and empty strings.

Allow test jars from wookie-spi to be used in implementations; and added to wookie-redis dependencies. This is so that we can define a set of common tests in wookie-spi that can be run for all implementations.
Added a method missing from API, to update sharedData by object as well as by strings
Refactored tests so that all the unit tests created for wookie-redis are in wookie-spi and can be reused by all SPI implementations
Make the default SPI implementations reuse the common test cases
Corrected test: trying to add a participant with an id matching an existing participant should return false, and not overwrite the existing participant
Applied fixes to SPI implementations to make sure they pass all the unit tests; this mostly involved adding null and empty string guards
Removed legacy non-REST API
Made the SPIs for prefs and shareddata consistent, requiring all the parameters used for the data (app, widget, context, viewer)
Created a HMAC authorization provider for Wookie REST APIs (see WOOKIE-279, and linked discussion with Tien). This will be used in place of "plaintext" API keys in Wookie 2.x
Implemented headers in Mock servlet request to make testing easier
Added a helper for making signed requests from functional tests
Added stateful requests, cookies and PUT body to the API test framework
Updated tests to use Request test framework class, and use signed API method calls
Changed structure of API key from "id, value, email" to "key, secret" following the HMAC authz scheme
Added the HMAC filter to all REST APIs. Only exception is GET /widgets[/*] for metadata access.
Improved support for ISO datetime format in timestamps
Support signed API requests in JS connector and the demo site
Use Request class for signed requests in test framework used for conformance testing
Moved queues from server core to JPA module
removing empty folders
Updated more functional tests to use HMAC signed requests for accessing the REST API
Added a helper to the connector for making signed API requests
Removed unused import
Changed Java connector to use HMAC-signed requests instead of HTTP BASIC AUTH
Removed unused imports
Removed unused utility classes; these supported the UI for requesting and emailing API keys in Wookie 1.x
Created a new Authz filter for requests from widgets to APIs, for example for handling preferences and metadata. This is so we can migrate these facilities from relying on DWR.
Replaced the DWR-based WidgetAPI with two REST servlets connected to the WidgetAuthorizationFilter in web.xml. This means we don't require DWR for simple widgets.
Replaced calls to DWR from the wookie.js feature script, instead using AJAX to directly call Wookie services
Removed dependency on DWR for core widgets; this is only needed for widgets using the Wave, oAuth and Wookie-Ext features.
Removed unused dependencies from pom.xml; many of these are instead now used as part of other modules.
added note on persistence providers
Fixed paths in parser tests; these had become broken when re-organizing the project structure.
Removed unused dependencies from cargo configuration
added null guard for participant thumbnail URL when rendering

Replaced calls to decryptAuthToken with calls to validateAuthToken. The difference is that the validate method also checks expiry times on tokens. The call decrpytAuthToken will be made private to avoid this problem in future.
Added a single-use flag to AuthToken, and some convenience constructors for different kinds of token.

Replaced calls to decryptAuthToken with calls to validateAuthToken. The difference is that the validate method also checks expiry times on tokens. The call decrpytAuthToken will be made private to avoid this problem in future. Also use new convenience constructor for a standard-lifespan token
Added a nonce to AuthToken; this is needed as when creating a new instance, the token must never be the same even when the "content" of the token is identical.
Use nonce and single use flag when encrypting and decrypting tokens
Created a cache for expired single-use tokens. See WOOKIE-426.
Use convenience constructors for tokens in tests, also added tests for nonce and single use
Added support for single-use tokens to authz filter (see WOOKIE-426)
Added an API for requesting a new token, either on first render to exchange a single-use token for a session token, or periodically to avoid token expiry.
Added token controller to the API
When a request is made to get or create an instance, mint a new single-use token to return for the URL of the widget. See WOOKIE-426.

Modified the core widget JS to first exchange the single-use token in the URL for a session token from the WOOKIE REST API (see WOOKIE-426). Also moved these various API calls into functions rather than inline within init() for better readability.
Updated HtmlCleaner to v 2.7 and removed redundant code. See WOOKIE-428
Send security tokens in Authorization header instead of in querystring (see WOOKIE-427)
Added support in REST API for POSTing or PUTting multiple preferences and shared data in one request. See WOOKIE-414
Updated test for cloning widget instances taking account changes to Properties API
Updated the JS connector used in the demo to take account of the changes to the Properties API
Re-implemented support for default preferences specified in config.xml, and added functional tests to ensure it works.

Removed the ApiKeys REST API from Wookie 2.x as this is no longer consistent with the new security model which relies on secrets not being transmitted over HTTP; if admins want to manage keys on the server remotely they need to do so via SSH, VPN etc.
Ensure the ApiKeys test restores the original state of the keys file after it executes, as otherwise it can cause other tests to fail
Removed debugging output
Changed version number in demo site
Use callbacks and async processing in the demo scripts; this is important as otherwise things can get tangled up very easily.
Added default service injection (store Prefs in server memory)
added Maven target folder to svn:ignore
Added workflow SPI (for locking and resuming widgets)

Ensure the abstract test works from a clean instance, otherwise if you run it alongside the DefaultImpl test they'll clash as they're working from the same in-memory store. (Basically, the in-memory store is not thread-safe - you need a single instance)
Added more stubs and updated license header
Added Redis module to build
Added build dir to svn:ignore
updated svn:ignore
